newsitem.title: UK: NYNEX expects C&W Communications offer.
newsitem.headline: NYNEX expects C&W Communications offer.

text.p: NYNEX CableComms Group Plc and NYNEX CableComms Group Inc said on Tuesday they expected Cable & Wireless Communications, formed to merge the UK interests of Cable & Wireless Plc, NYNEX Corporation and Bell Canada International, to make an offer to CableComms shareholders.

"The Boards of CableComms will consider the implications of the proposed merger in the normal course and will make their views known once they have had the opportunity to do so," the companies said in a statement.

Earlier the three cable and telecommunications giants announced the merger of Mercury Communications, NYNEX CableComms Group Plc and NYNEX CableComms Group Inc, Bell Cablemedia and Videotron Holdings.

They said the new company will provide "local, national, international, data and mobile telecommunications, together with multichannel television and Internet services" to around six million franchised homes and to businesses throughout Britain.
NYNEX Corp said it had agreed to "give irrevocable undertakings to accept the offer for NYNEX CableComms when made in respect of its 71.2 percent direct and indirect interest".
